page.title: I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 10)

revisions.rev:
{{IACGMOOH contestants | hmpage = | seriesname = [[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK TV series)|I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!]] | image = | series = Series Ten (2010) | previous = I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 9) | next = I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 11) | hm1 = Stacey Solomon | hm1-exit = Day 21 | hm1-enter = Day 1 | hm1-stat = winner | hm2 = Shaun Ryder | hm2-exit = Day 21 | hm2-enter = Day 1 | hm2-stat = runner | hm3 = Jenny Eclair | hm3-exit = Day 20 | hm3-enter = Day 4 | hm3-stat = evic | hm4 = Dom Joly | hm4-exit = Day 19 | hm4-enter = Day 4 | hm4-stat = evic | hm5 = Kayla Collins | hm5-exit = Day 19 | hm5-stat = evic | hm5-enter = Day 1 | hm5-stat = evic | hm6 = Aggro Santos | hm6-exit = Day 18 | hm6-enter = Day 1 | hm6-stat = evic | hm7 = Linford Christie | hm7-exit = Day 17 | hm7-enter = Day 1 | hm7-stat = evic | hm8 = Gillian McKeith | hm8-exit = Day 16 | hm8-enter = Day 1 | hm8-stat = evic | hm9 = Britt Ekland | hm9-exit = Day 15 | hm9-enter = Day 1 | hm9-stat = evic | hm10 = Alison Hammond | hm10-exit = Day 14 | hm10-enter = Day 6 | hm10-stat = evic | hm11 = Lembit Ãpik | hm11-exit = Day 13 | hm11-enter = Day 1 | hm11-stat = evic | hm12 = Sheryl Gascoigne | hm12-exit = Day 12 | hm12-enter = Day 1 | hm12-stat = evic | hm13 = Nigel Havers | hm13-exit = Day 9 | hm13-enter = Day 1 | hm13-stat = five | legend5 = Withdrew }} '''''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK TV series)|I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!]]''''' returned for its tenth series on 14 November 2010. It ran for 3 weeks.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a285366/itv-confirms-im-a-celebrity-return-date.html|title=ITV confirms 'I'm A Celebrity' return date|publisher=Digital Spy|date=1 November 2010|first=Ryan|last=Love}} [[Ant & Dec]] returned as the presenters for the main show, and its spin off show ''Get Me out of Here... Now'' returned,{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/digitaltv/news/a280934/itv2-hd-prepares-for-sky-launch.html|title=ITV2 HD prepares for Sky launch|publisher=Digital Spy|first=Andrew|last=Laughlin|date=7 October 2010}} with [[Caroline Flack]] and [[Joe Swash]] as main presenters.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a283372/porter-cundy-linked-to-im-a-celebrity.html|title=Porter, Cundy linked to 'I'm A Celebrity'|date=21 October 2010|publisher=Digital Spy|first=Alex|last=Fletcher}} On 4 December 2010, singer [[Stacey Solomon]] won the show. ==Celebrities== On 10 November, [[ITV]] officially confirmed the 10 celebrities taking part. [[Dom Joly]], [[Gail Porter]] and [[Alison Hammond]], initially reported to be joining the show, were not on the list, but Joly and Hammond were later reported to be in Australia on standby for a possible late entry to the show.{{cite news |title=Joly, Hammond to join 'I'm A Celeb'? |author=Alex Fletcher |publisher=Digital Spy |date=11 November 2010 |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a287320/joly-hammond-to-join-im-a-celeb.html}} Playboy model [[Kayla Collins]] has been added to the list to complete the lineup.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a287081/confirmed-official-im-a-celeb-lineup.html |title=Confirmed: Official 'I'm A Celeb' lineup |last=Fletcher |first=Alex |date=10 November 2010 |publisher=Digital Spy |accessdate=10 November 2010}} At the beginning of the series the contestants will be once again divided into separate camps, Camp Bruce (males) and Camp Sheila (females). The contestants entered the jungle either by skydiving into camp or paddling in on canoes. Those facing a watery entrance had to canoe across a lake before crawling through a damp and dark tunnel. The first five-part trial "Terrovision" will reward the winners with one last night of luxury and punishes the losers with a premature entrance into the jungle. The first four tasks earn the winning team one point each, the fifth and final task will decide which group makes their way into the bush.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/celebrity/article-1329720/Im-A-Celebrity-2010-Stacey-Solomons-unsavoury-meal-Gillian-McKeiths-spider-phobia.html|title=Iâm A Celebrity: Stacey Solomon has an unsavoury meal... as jumpy Gillian McKeith annoys everyone with her spider phobia|date=2010-11-15|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=2010-11-15}} Gillian McKeith became the first contestant in the history of the show to refuse a task. As the contestant for the task is chosen by a public vote using a premium rate phone number, ITV must refund anyone who asks the cost of their telephone vote.{{cite web|url=http://celebrity.itv.com/2010/DailyNews/-refund-1422|title=Iâm A Celebrity: Gillian Mckeith Refund Application|date=2010-11-22|work=ITV|accessdate=2010-11-22}} [[Dom Joly]] and [[Jenny Eclair]] entered the jungle on 18 November,{{cite news |title=Two more stars confirmed for 'I'm A Celeb' |first=Alex |last=Fletcher |publisher=Digital Spy |date=17 November 2010 |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a288263/two-more-stars-confirmed-for-im-a-celeb.html}} with more celebrities to enter the show later in the series. [[Alison Hammond]] was revealed as the 13th contestant to enter the jungle on Day 6 in ''I'm a Celeb NOW!'' she arrived in the jungle in a crate, but the others did not know who was inside.{{cite news |title=Alison Hammond to enter 'I'm A Celebrity' |first=Naomi |last=Rainey |publisher=Digital Spy |date=19 November 2010 |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a288684/alison-hammond-to-enter-im-a-celebrity.html}} {| class="wikitable" style="margin:auto; text-align:center; font-size:100%;" |- ! scope="col" | Celebrity ! scope="col" | Known for ! scope="col" | Status |- |scope="row"|[[Nigel Havers]] |''[[Coronation Street]]'' actor | style="background:#D8BFD8; text-align:center;"|

to win |} Voting stats here: http://celebrity.itv.com/2010/DailyNews/im-celebrity-results-1698 ===Notes=== {{note|1|1}} In order to win immunity from the first public vote all the celebrities took part in a task called "Kangaroo Court". The two losers from each round would then go to Jungle Jail (located in camp), in the end the celebrities left in jail at the end of the task would face the first public vote.
{{note|2|2}} All of the celebrities faced the public vote; the bottom two were revealed as Alison and Kayla. The other celebrities were declared safe and on Day 15 both Alison and Kayla faced a bushtucker trial called The Dentalist where the winner (Kayla) returned to camp and the loser (Alison) was eliminated.
{{note|3|3}} The public were voting for who they wanted to win rather than to save. ==The Camps== For the first three days of the show, the group of celebrities were split between two camps: "Camp Bruce" (the boys), and "Camp Sheila" (the girls). The celebrities in each group were: * '''Camp Bruce:''' Aggro, Lembit, Linford, Nigel, Shaun * '''Camp Sheila:''' Britt, Gillian, Kayla, Sheryl, Stacey Both camps were supposed to be as good as each other, although there were some differences between the camps. Camp Sheila contained a pink and white recleiner, a picture of a shirtless man holding a baby and the beds were pink. Camp Bruce contained a black leather recleiner, a picture of a women scratching her bottom in tennis clothes and the beds were blue, Camp Bruce also was slightly bigger. On 18 November 2010, the two camps merged. The celebrities in the Camp Sheila moved into the Camp Bruce, as it was bigger. ==Bushtucker trials== The contestants take part in daily trials to earn food :{{colorbox|#FFFF99}} The public vote for who they want to face the trial :{{colorbox|#AFEEEE}} The contestants decide who does which trial :{{colorbox|lightgreen}} The trial is compulsory and neither the public nor celebrities decide who take part {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col" | Trial

{{ref|13|See note 13}}
{{ref|14|See note 14}} |} ===Notes=== {{note|1|1}} The celebrities were split up into two camps (Camp Bruce for Boys and Camp Sheila for Girls), the winners (the Girls) spent their first night of the show in luxury and the losers (the Boys) spent their first night of the show in a makeshift camp.
{{note|2|2}} Britt, Gillian and Nigel were excluded from this trial on medical grounds.
{{note|3|3}} Alison was excluded because she was new to the camp.
{{note|4|4}} Gillian was allowed to bring someone to help her in this trial; she chose Sheryl.
{{note|5|5}} Gillian was the first celebrity to not even attempt a bushtucker trial in all ten series of the show.
{{note|6|6}} Gillian was originally selected to do the trial, but required medical attention and was unable to start it, she received 56.15% of the vote to do the trial.
{{note|7|7}} Britt, Gillian and Alison were excluded from this trial on medical grounds.
{{note|8|8}} Britt was excluded from this trial on medical grounds.
{{note|9|9}} This trial decided who would leave camp and not how camp would be fed. When the trial ended in a draw with both refusing to face the tie-breaker, the public vote was used to decide.
{{note|10|10}} This trial previously was meant to be done by Gillian on Day 8, although she refused to take part.
{{note|11|11}} For the first time ever all celebrities took part in the trial to earn their final meal as a three.
{{note|12|12}} The final trial was the same trial that Dean took part in on Series 6.
{{note|13|13}} The two remaining celebrities were allowed to chose any meal they wanted from anywhere, although it came with a price, the price was that they would have to take part in the final live trial.
{{note|14|14}} If Shaun refused to take part in any part of the trial Lembit would be punished and if Stacey refused to take part in any part of the trial Dom would be punished, although Shaun and Stacey did not refuse any part of the trial meaning Dom and Lembit were not punished. == Ratings == Official ratings are taken from the [[Broadcasters' Audience Research Board]].{{cite web|url=http://www.barb.co.uk/report/weeklyTopProgrammesOverview?|title=Weekly Top 30 Programmes|publisher=[[Broadcasters' Audience Research Board]]|accessdate=16 November 2010}} {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:45%;" |- ! scope="col" | Show ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Official rating
(millions) ! scope="col" | Weekly rank
